arm_group.arm_group_label: high fat meal without dairy products
arm_group.description: high fat meal without dairy products

arm_group.arm_group_label: high fat meal with additional milk
arm_group.description: high fat meal with additional milk

brief_summary.textblock:
The study will quantitatively evaluate the systemic, postprandial inflammatory and metabolic
      response to the ingestion of three different meals in obese subjects. The administered meals
      will differ in the proportion of dairy products. Postprandial response will be monitored
      during 6 hours after meal consumption.

clinical_study.brief_title: Impact of Dairy Products on Postprandial Inflammation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  male

          -  BMI ≥ 20 kg/m2

          -  age 25-55 y

          -  informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Physiological or psychological diseases

          -  Allergies to food or intolerance to high-fat meal

          -  Vegetarians

          -  Chronic intake of drugs

          -  Smokers

          -  Diabetes mellitus Type I and II

          -  Debilitating kidney diseases

          -  Debilitating liver diseases

          -  Clinically established coronary heart diseases

          -  Ingestion of vitamins or dietary supplements during the course of the study

intervention.intervention_name: consumption of test meal based on dairy products

intervention.arm_group_label: high fat meal without dairy products
intervention.intervention_name: consumption of high fat test meal without dairy products

intervention.arm_group_label: high fat meal with additional milk

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Dairy Products on Postprandial Inflammation in Obese Males

primary_outcome.measure: Inflammation markers in blood plasma (IL-6, TNF-alpha)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Biomarkers in blood (serum insulin, plasma glucose, GLP-1, lipids)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
